references.paper_title: Domain adaptive faster r-cnn for object detection in the wild
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of domain adaptive object detection, introducing the problem and setting the stage for many subsequent works, including this one.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a highly influential visual-language model whose visual encoder is leveraged in this paper for domain adaptation.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable features with deep adaptation networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Deep Adaptation Networks (DAN), a highly influential approach for domain adaptation that addresses the problem of domain discrepancy in deep learning models.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces ResNet, a key convolutional neural network architecture used as the backbone in many object detection models, including this one.

references.paper_title: You only look once: Unified, real-time object detection
references.reason: This paper introduces YOLO, a highly influential and efficient object detection method, whose architecture is adapted in this paper.
